   22: -module(dtls_api_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: %% Callback functions
   25: -export([all/0,
   26:          groups/0,
   27:          init_per_suite/1,
   28:          end_per_suite/1,
   29:          init_per_group/2,
   30:          end_per_group/2,
   31:          init_per_testcase/2,
   32:          end_per_testcase/2]).
   33: 
   34: %% Testcases
   35: -export([
   36:          replay_window/0, replay_window/1,
   37:          dtls_listen_owner_dies/0,
   38:          dtls_listen_owner_dies/1,
   39:          dtls_listen_close/0,
   40:          dtls_listen_close/1,
   41:          dtls_listen_reopen/0,
   42:          dtls_listen_reopen/1,
   43:          dtls_listen_both_family/0,
   44:          dtls_listen_both_family/1,
   45:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_1/0,
   46:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_1/1,
   47:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_2/0,
   48:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_2/1,
   49:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_3/0,
   50:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_3/1,
   51:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_4/0,
   52:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_4/1,
   53:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_5/0,
   54:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_5/1,
   55:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_6/0,
   56:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_6/1,
   57:          client_restarts/0, client_restarts/1,
   58:          client_restarts_multiple_acceptors/1
   59:         ]).
   60: 
   61: -include("ssl_test_lib.hrl").
   62: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_internal.hrl").
   63: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_api.hrl").
   64: 
   65: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   66: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   67: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   68: all() ->
   69:     [
   70:      replay_window,
   71:      {group, 'dtlsv1.2'},
   72:      {group, 'dtlsv1'}
   73:     ].
   74: 
   75: groups() ->
   76:     [
   77:      {'dtlsv1.2', [],  api_tests()},
   78:      {'dtlsv1', [],  api_tests()}
   79:     ].
   80: 
   81: api_tests() ->
   82:     [
   83:      dtls_listen_owner_dies,
   84:      dtls_listen_close,
   85:      dtls_listen_reopen,
   86:      dtls_listen_both_family,
   87:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_1,
   88:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_2,
   89:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_3,
   90:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_4,
   91:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_5,
   92:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_6,
   93:      client_restarts,
   94:      client_restarts_multiple_acceptors
   95:     ].
   96: 
   97: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   98:     catch application:stop(crypto),
   99:     try application:start(crypto) of
  100: 	ok ->
  101: 	    ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
  102: 	    ssl_test_lib:make_rsa_cert(Config0)
  103:     catch _:_ ->
  104: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  105:     end.
  106: 
  107: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  108:     ssl:stop(),
  109:     application:unload(ssl),
  110:     application:stop(crypto).
  111: 
  112: 
  113: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  114:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  115: 
  116: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  117:     ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  118: 
  119: init_per_testcase(Testcase, Config)
  120:   when Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_1 orelse
  121:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_5 orelse
  122:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_6 ->
  123:     case ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,2}}]) of
  124:         {ok, S} ->
  125:             test_listen_on_all_interfaces(S, Config),
  126:             ssl:close(S),
  127:             ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  128:             ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  129:             maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(Testcase, Config);
  130:         {error, _} ->
  131:             {skip, "127.0.0.x address not available"}
  132:     end;
  133: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  134:     ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  135:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  136:     Config.
  137: 
  138: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->     
  139:     Config.
  140: 
  141: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  142: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  143: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  144: 
  145: dtls_listen_owner_dies() ->
  146:     [{doc, "Test that you can start new DTLS 'listener' if old owner dies"}].
  147: 
  148: dtls_listen_owner_dies(Config) when is_list(Config) ->    
  149:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  150:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  151:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  152: 
  153:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  154:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> {ok, _} =
  155:                                             ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  156:                                         [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  157:                                         {error, _} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts])
  158:                                end),
  159:     receive
  160:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, Pid, _} ->
  161:             ok
  162:     end,
  163:     [] = listener_and_ports(),   %% Verify that ports are cleaned up after listener owner dies
  164:     {ok, LSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  165:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  166:     spawn(fun() ->
  167:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket),
  168:                   {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  169:                   receive
  170:                       {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  171:                           ssl:send(Socket, "from server"),
  172:                           ssl:close(Socket)
  173:                   after 2000 ->
  174:                           ct:log("GOT WRONG MSG ~p~n", [flush()]),
  175:                           ct:log("Expected ~p~n", [ {ssl, Socket, "from client"}]),
  176:                           ct:fail(wrong_msg)
  177:                   end
  178:           end),
  179:     {ok, Client} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts),
  180: 
  181:     ssl:send(Client, "from client"),
  182:     receive
  183:         {ssl, Client, "from server"} ->
  184:             ssl:close(Client)
  185:     after 5000 ->
  186:             ct:log("GOT WRONG MSG ~p~n", [flush()]),
  187:             ct:fail(wrong_msg)
  188:     end.
  189: 
  190: dtls_listen_close() ->
  191:     [{doc, "Test that you close a DTLS 'listener' socket"}].
  192: 
  193: dtls_listen_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  194:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  195:     {_, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  196: 
  197:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  198:     {ok, ListenSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  199:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  200:     ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket),
  201:     [] = listener_and_ports(),
  202:     {ok, ListenSocket2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  203:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  204:     ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket2, 500),
  205:     [] = listener_and_ports(),
  206:     ok.
  207: 
  208: dtls_listen_reopen() ->
  209:     [{doc, "Test that you close a DTLS 'listner' socket and open a new one for the same port"}].
  210: 
  211: dtls_listen_reopen(Config) when is_list(Config) -> 
  212:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  213:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  214:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  215: 
  216:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  217:     {ok, LSocket0} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  218:      spawn(fun() ->
  219:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket0),
  220:                    {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  221:                    receive
  222:                        {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  223:                            ssl:send(Socket, "from server 1"),
  224:                            ssl:close(Socket)
  225:                    end
  226:            end),
  227:     {ok, Client1} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts),
  228:     ok = ssl:close(LSocket0),
  229:     {ok, LSocket1} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  230:     spawn(fun() ->
  231:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket1),
  232:                   {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  233:                   receive
  234:                       {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  235:                           ssl:send(Socket, "from server 2"),
  236:                           ssl:close(Socket)
  237:                    end
  238:           end),
  239:     {ok, Client2} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ClientOpts]),
  240:     ssl:send(Client2, "from client"),
  241:     ssl:send(Client1, "from client"),
  242:     receive
  243:         {ssl, Client1, "from server 1"} ->
  244:             ssl:close(Client1)
  245:     end,
  246:     receive
  247:         {ssl, Client2, "from server 2"} ->
  248:             ssl:close(Client2)
  249:     end.
  250: 
  251: dtls_listen_both_family() ->
  252:     [].
  253: %%    [{require, ipv6_hosts}].
  254: dtls_listen_both_family(Config) ->
  255:     {ok, Hostname0} = inet:gethostname(),
  256: 
  257:     TestIPV6 = case ct:get_config(ipv6_hosts) of
  258:                   Hosts when is_list(Hosts) ->
  259:                       lists:member(list_to_atom(Hostname0), Hosts);
  260:                   undefined ->
  261:                       ct:log("Local tests (ipv6 probably works)", []),
  262:                       true
  263:               end,
  264:     case TestIPV6 of
  265:         true ->
  266:             {_, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  267:             Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  268:             {ok, ListenSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  269:             [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  270: 
  271:             {ok, ListenSocketIpV6} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, inet6, {ipv6_v6only,true}]),
  272:             [_,_] = listener_and_ports(),
  273: 
  274:             ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket),
  275:             ok = ssl:close(ListenSocketIpV6);
  276:         false ->
  277:             {skip, "Host does not support IPv6"}
  278:     end.
  279: 
  280: dtls_listen_two_sockets_1() ->
  281:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: 127.0.0.2:Port, 127.0.0.3:Port"}].
  282: dtls_listen_two_sockets_1(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  283:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,2}}]),
  284:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  285:     {ok, S2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  286:     ssl:close(S1),
  287:     ssl:close(S2),
  288:     ok.
  289: 
  290: dtls_listen_two_sockets_2() ->
  291:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  292: dtls_listen_two_sockets_2(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  293:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  294:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  295:     {error, already_listening} =
  296:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  297:     ssl:close(S1),
  298:     ok.
  299: 
  300: dtls_listen_two_sockets_3() ->
  301:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  302: dtls_listen_two_sockets_3(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  303:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  304:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  305:     {error, already_listening} =
  306:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  307:     ssl:close(S1),
  308:     {ok, S2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  309:     ssl:close(S2),
  310:     ok.
  311: 
  312: dtls_listen_two_sockets_4() ->
  313:   [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: process1 - <all_interfaces>:Port, process2 - <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  314: dtls_listen_two_sockets_4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  315:     Test = self(),
  316:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  317:                   {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  318:                   {ok, {_, Port0}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  319:                   Test ! {self(), Port0}
  320:                 end),
  321:     Port =
  322:         receive
  323:             {Pid, Port1} ->
  324:                 Port1
  325:         end,
  326:     {ok, S2} =
  327:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  328:     ssl:close(S2),
  329:     ok.
  330: 
  331: dtls_listen_two_sockets_5() ->
  332:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, 127.0.0.3:Port"}].
  333: dtls_listen_two_sockets_5(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  334:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  335:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  336:     {error, already_listening} =
  337:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  338:     ssl:close(S1),
  339:     {ok, S2} =
  340:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  341:     {error, already_listening} =
  342:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  343:     ssl:close(S2),
  344:     ok.
  345: 
  346: dtls_listen_two_sockets_6() ->
  347:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: 127.0.0.3:Port, 0.0.0.0:Port"}].
  348: dtls_listen_two_sockets_6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  349:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  350:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  351:     {error, already_listening} =
  352:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {0,0,0,0}}]),
  353:     ssl:close(S1),
  354:     ok.
  355: 
  356: listener_and_ports() ->
  357:     timer:sleep(200), %% Allow some time to start och delete dead children
  358:     Pids = [Pid || {_, Pid, _, _} <- supervisor:which_children(dtls_listener_sup)],
  359:     PidPorts = [{element(2, erlang:port_info(P, connected)), P}
  360:                 || P <- erlang:ports(), {name, "udp_inet"} == erlang:port_info(P, name)],
  361:     PidWithoutPort = [Pid || Pid <- Pids, not lists:keymember(Pid, 1, PidPorts)],
  362:     PidPorts ++ PidWithoutPort.
  363: 
  364: replay_window() ->
  365:     [{doc, "Whitebox test of replay window"}].
  366: replay_window(_Config) ->
  367:     W0 = dtls_record:init_replay_window(),
  368:     Size = 58,
  369:     true = replay_window(0, 0, Size-1, [], W0),
  370:     ok.
  371: 
  372: replay_window(N, Top, Sz, Used, W0) when N < 99000 ->
  373:     Bottom = max(0, Top - Sz),
  374:     Seq = max(0, Bottom + rand:uniform(Top-Bottom+10)-5),
  375:     IsReplay = (Seq < Bottom) orelse lists:member(Seq, Used),
  376:     case dtls_record:is_replay(Seq,W0) of
  377:         true when IsReplay ->
  378:             replay_window(N+1, Top, Sz, Used, W0);
  379:         false when (not IsReplay) ->
  380:             #{replay_window:=W1} = dtls_record:update_replay_window(Seq, #{replay_window=>W0}),
  381:             NewTop = if Seq > Top -> Seq;
  382:                         true -> Top
  383:                      end,
  384:             NewBottom = max(0, (NewTop - Sz)),
  385:             NewUsed = lists:dropwhile(fun(S) -> S < NewBottom end,
  386:                                       lists:sort([Seq|Used])),
  387:             replay_window(N+1, NewTop, Sz, NewUsed, W1);
  388:         Replay ->
  389:             io:format("Try: ~p Top: ~w Sz: ~p Used:~p State: ~w~n", [N, Top, Sz, length(Used), W0]),
  390:             io:format("Seq: ~w Replay: ~p (~p)~n ~w~n ~w~n",
  391:                       [Seq, Replay, IsReplay, Used, bits_to_list(W0)]),
  392:             {fail, Replay, Seq, W0}
  393:     end;
  394: replay_window(N, Top, Sz, Used, W0) ->
  395:     io:format("Try: ~p Top: ~w Sz: ~p Used:~p State: ~w~n", [N, Top, Sz, length(Used), W0]),
  396:     io:format("Match ~w ~n", [bits_to_list(W0) =:= Used]),
  397:     bits_to_list(W0) =:= Used.
  398: 
  399: bits_to_list(#{mask := Bits, bottom:= Bottom}) ->
  400:     bits_to_list(Bits, Bottom, []).
  401: 
  402: bits_to_list(0, _, Is) ->
  403:     lists:reverse(Is);
  404: bits_to_list(Bits, I, Acc) ->
  405:     case Bits band 1 of
  406:         1 -> bits_to_list(Bits bsr 1, I+1, [I|Acc]);
  407:         0 -> bits_to_list(Bits bsr 1, I+1, Acc)
  408:     end.
  409: 
  410: client_restarts() ->
  411:     [{doc, "Test re-connection "}].
  412: 
  413: client_restarts(Config) ->
  414:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  415:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  416:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  417: 
  418:     ClientOpts = [{verify, verify_none},{reuse_sessions, save} | ClientOpts0],
  419:     Server =
  420: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  421: 				   {from, self()},
  422:                                    {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  423: 				   {options, [{verify, verify_none}|ServerOpts]}]),
  424:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  425:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode},
  426:                                          {port, Port}, {host, Hostname},
  427:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  428:                                          {from, self()},
  429:                                          {options, ClientOpts}]),
  430: 
  431:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  432:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  433: 
  434:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  435:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  436: 
  437:     Msgs = lists:sort([{Server, Msg1}, {Client0, Msg2}]),
  438:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  439: 
  440:     ReConnect =  %% Whitebox re-connect test
  441:         fun(#sslsocket{connection_cb = dtls_gen_connection = ConnectionCb,
  442:                        connection_handler = Pid} = Socket, ssl) ->
  443:                 ?CT_LOG("Client Socket: ~p ~n", [Socket]),
  444:                 {ok, IntSocket} = gen_statem:call(Pid, {downgrade, self()}),
  445:                 {{Address,CPort},UDPSocket}=IntSocket,
  446:                 ?CT_LOG("Info: ~p~n", [inet:info(UDPSocket)]),
  447: 
  448:                 {ok, #config{transport_info = CbInfo,
  449:                              ssl = SslOpts0}} =
  450:                     ssl_config:handle_options(ClientOpts, client, Address),
  451:                 SslOpts = {SslOpts0, #socket_options{}, undefined},
  452: 
  453:                 ct:sleep(250),
  454:                 ?CT_LOG("Client second connect: ~p ~p~n", [Socket, CbInfo]),
  455:                 {ok, NewSocket} = dtls_gen_connection:start_fsm(client, Address, CPort, IntSocket,
  456:                                                                 SslOpts, self(), CbInfo, infinity),
  457:                 {replace, NewSocket}
  458:         end,
  459: 
  460:     Client0 ! {apply, self(), ReConnect},
  461:     receive
  462:         {apply_res, {replace, Res}} ->
  463:             ?CT_LOG("Apply res: ~p~n", [Res]),
  464:             ok;
  465:         ErrMsg ->
  466:             ?CT_LOG("Unhandled: ~p~n", [ErrMsg]),
  467:             ct:fail({wrong_msg, ErrMsg})
  468:     end,
  469: 
  470:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  471:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  472: 
  473:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  474:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  475: 
  476:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  477: 
  478:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  479:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
  480:     ok.
  481: 
  482: 
  483: flush() ->
  484:     receive Msg -> [Msg|flush()]
  485:     after 500 -> []
  486:     end.
  487: 
  488: client_restarts_multiple_acceptors(Config) ->
  489:     %% Can also be tested with openssl by connecting a client and hit
  490:     %% Ctrl+C to kill openssl process, so that the connection is not
  491:     %% closed.
  492:     %% Then do a new openssl connect with the same client port.
  493: 
  494:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  495:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  496:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  497: 
  498:     ClientOpts = [{verify, verify_none},{reuse_sessions, save} | ClientOpts0],
  499:     Server =
  500: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  501: 				   {from, self()},
  502:                                    {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  503:                                    {accepters, 2},
  504: 				   {options, [{verify, verify_none}|ServerOpts]}]),
  505:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  506:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode},
  507:                                          {port, Port}, {host, Hostname},
  508:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  509:                                          {from, self()},
  510:                                          {options, ClientOpts}]),
  511: 
  512:     Server2 = receive {accepter, 2, Server2Pid} -> Server2Pid
  513:               after 5000 -> ct:fail(msg_timeout)
  514:               end,
  515: 
  516:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  517:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  518: 
  519:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  520:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  521: 
  522:     Msgs = lists:sort([{Server, Msg1}, {Client0, Msg2}]),
  523:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  524: 
  525:     ReConnect =  %% Whitebox re-connect test
  526:         fun(#sslsocket{connection_cb = dtls_gen_connection = ConnectionCb,
  527:                        connection_handler = Pid} = Socket, ssl) ->
  528:                 ?CT_LOG("Client Socket: ~p ~n", [Socket]),
  529:                 {ok, IntSocket} = gen_statem:call(Pid, {downgrade, self()}),
  530:                 {{Address,CPort},UDPSocket}=IntSocket,
  531:                 ?CT_LOG("Info: ~p~n", [inet:info(UDPSocket)]),
  532:                 {ok, #config{transport_info = CbInfo,
  533:                              ssl = SslOpts0}} =
  534:                     ssl_config:handle_options(ClientOpts, client, Address),
  535:                 SslOpts = {SslOpts0, #socket_options{}, undefined},
  536:                 ct:sleep(250),
  537:                 ?CT_LOG("Client second connect: ~p ~p~n", [Socket, CbInfo]),
  538:                 {ok, NewSocket} = dtls_gen_connection:start_fsm(client, Address, CPort, IntSocket,
  539:                                                                 SslOpts, self(), CbInfo, infinity),
  540:                 {replace, NewSocket}
  541:         end,
  542:  
  543:     Client0 ! {apply, self(), ReConnect},
  544:     receive
  545:         {apply_res, {replace, Res}} ->
  546:             ?CT_LOG("Apply res: ~p~n", [Res]),
  547:             ok;
  548:         ErrMsg ->
  549:             ?CT_LOG("Unhandled: ~p~n", [ErrMsg]),
  550:             ct:fail({wrong_msg, ErrMsg})
  551:     end,
  552: 
  553:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg3 = "from client 2"),
  554:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Server2, Msg4 = "from server 2 to client 2"),
  555:     {error, closed} = ssl_test_lib:send(Server,  "Should be closed"),
  556: 
  557:     Msgs2 = lists:sort([{Server2, Msg3}, {Client0, Msg4}]),
  558: 
  559:     Server2 ! {active_receive, Msg3},
  560:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg4},
  561: 
  562:     Msgs2 = lists:sort(flush()),
  563: 
  564:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  565:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server2),
  566:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
  567:     ok.
  568: 
  569: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  570: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
  571: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  572: 
  573: %% Helper function for init_per_testcase.
  574: test_listen_on_all_interfaces(S0, Config) ->
  575:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S0),
  576:     case ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {0,0,0,0}}]) of
  577:         {ok, S1} ->
  578:             ssl:close(S0),
  579:             ssl:close(S1),
  580:             {skip, "Testcase is not supported on this OS."};
  581:         {error, _} ->
  582:             Config
  583:     end.
  584: 
  585: maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(Testcase, Config)
  586:   when Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_5 orelse
  587:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_6 ->
  588:     case os:type() of
  589:         {win32, _} ->
  590:             {skip, "Testcase not supported in Windows"};
  591:         _ ->
  592:             Config
  593:     end;
  594: maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(_, Config) ->
  595:     Config.
